title: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved (including the quotes). The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. An additional dialog appears with the options: 'Yes' to save the changes, 'No' to discard the changes, and 'Cancel' to do nothing and remain on the Source page. The dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).
OB: The current 'Dirty Page' behavior in the XML Report Designer editor is confusing for users. It does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard changes, and the options presented are unclear.
EB: The 'Dirty Page' behavior in the XML Report Designer editor should be improved. It should clearly indicate that the XML Report Design has been changed. The dialog title should be changed to something more appropriate, without the quotes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Make changes to the XML Report Design.
3. Attempt to navigate to other pages without saving the changes.
4. A dialog should appear asking the user if they want to save the changes.
5. The dialog should have clear buttons with labels indicating the actions (such as 'Save', 'Discard', and 'Cancel').
